The company had sought an an injunction to prevent the CCI CCI from from enforcing enforcing its decision , which had been issued in November November 2020 , that the company abused abused its market power by requiring handset handset makers to pre - install certain Google Google apps . [[ ]] In its ruling , the the Competition Commission of of India found Google ’s Android operating system was used to to give its its search engine engine an unfair advantage advantage over its rivals . The CCI further argued that Google ’s ’s use of of its app store as a monopoly to force device manufacturers to install Google apps stifled competition in the market market . Google had sought to block the ruling , arguing that the allegations allegations of of anti - competitive behavior were were “ unfounded ” and and that it was not given given a fair hearing hearing before the CCI . The CCI , however , ruled against Google , noting that it had conducted a thorough investigation before ruling against the tech giant . In response to the ruling , Google said in in a statement statement that that it it was disappointed with the decision and that it “ will continue to defend our ability to freely develop and offer products products to users users and to ensure that Android Android remains an an open platform . ” The company also said that it would review the decision and consider consider its options . The Competition Commission ’s ruling ruling is a major victory for the anti - monopoly movement and could have far - reaching implications implications for other tech giants giants such as as Amazon Amazon , Apple , and Facebook . text: VATICAN CITY CITY , Dec 31 ( Reuters Reuters ) - The body body of of former Pope Benedict XVI , who died on Saturday , will lie in state in St. Peter 's Basilica on Monday and remain there for three days before his funeral , which is set for Jan. 5 . Here are the initial initial details of the the ceremonies , as outlined outlined in a Vatican Vatican statement . LYING IN STATE [[ ]] Until early early Monday morning , Benedict 's body will remain in the small small monastery within the Vatican where he lived . No official official visits to see his body , or or public prayers , will be held held during during this time time . On Monday it will be moved to St. Peter 's Basilica Basilica , where where the public can view the body from 9 a.m. ( 0800 GMT ) to 7 p.m. ( 1800 GMT ) on Jan. 2 , 3 and 4 . FUNERAL Benedict 's funeral will will be held on Thursday , Jan. 5 in in St. Peter 's Square , in front of of the basilica basilica . The ceremony will start at 9:30 9:30 a.m. ( 0830 GMT ) and will be presided over by Pope Francis . Vatican spokesman Matteo Bruni said that that following the the wishes of Benedict , the funeral would be be simple simple , solemn and sober . Papal funerals typically draw draw heads of state from around the world , but the Vatican has has said that official delegations will come only from Italy and from Benedict 's native Germany Germany , suggesting the the event will be relatively low key key . Representatives from other countries or organisations can attend in a private capacity , diplomats were told told . BURIAL [[ ]] The Vatican said that after the ceremony , Benedict 's body will be taken back inside St. Peter 's Basilica Basilica and buried in the the Vatican Grottoes , beneath the church , where more than 90 popes have found their final resting place . In In 2020 , Benedict 's authorised authorised biographer , Peter Peter Seewald , was quoted as telling Bavarian newspaper newspaper Passauer Neue Presse that that the emeritus pope had prepared a spiritual testament stating that he wanted to be buried in the same crypt where John Paul II was originally laid to rest in 2005 . John Paul 's body was later later moved moved following his beatification beatification in 2011 to a chapel chapel on the main level of the basilica next to the one where Michelangelo 's Pieta is displayed . text: Leaders from the Asia Pacific Economic Cooperation ( APEC APEC ) meeting in Jakarta have made a last - ditch effort to help end the crisis in Ukraine . The event has been attended attended by leaders from from the United States States , China , Japan , South Korea and other key members members of of the APEC APEC group . The main main focus of the the meeting was to discuss the economic situation situation in Ukraine , which has been in turmoil for years . The conflict between the the government and pro - Russian Russian separatists has been particularly fierce in the eastern eastern part of the country . The APEC meeting was intended to add further impetus to the talks between the two sides , which have been taking place in Minsk Minsk and Kiev over the the past year year . “ This summit is about making a final push for peace in Ukraine , ” said U.S. Secretary of of State Rex Tillerson , who attended the the event event . Tillerson ’s presence was seen as a sign of U.S. commitment to to the peace process process . He has been instrumental in pushing for a diplomatic solution solution to the conflict . Speaking at the event , Russian President Vladimir Putin said that he was was willing to engage engage in “ unconditional dialogue ” to achieve a solution to the the crisis . [[ ]] “ We must strive for a peaceful settlement of the Ukrainian crisis crisis , ” Putin said . Beulah Koerner , of Council Bluffs Bluffs , Iowa , died Sunday morning at the age of 115 years and 148 days , her family told NBC affiliate WOWT in Omaha . Koerner was born in in Nebraska on June 24 , 1907 , and and lived most of her life in Omaha Omaha . She She later moved to Council Council Bluffs , Iowa , where she she died died . " She was a loving and caring daughter , sister sister , mother , grandmother grandmother , great great grandmother and great - great grandmother , " her family said in a statement statement . " She was always willing to share her stories , advice and tales of of the ' olden days . ' " [[ ]] Koerner Koerner worked for the Omaha Public Power Power District for 15 years before before retiring in 1973 . She She then went on on to become a crossing guard for the Council Bluffs Public School School District for more than 10 years years . " My grandmother was an amazing woman , " said her granddaughter granddaughter , Liz Liz Jameson . " She lived such a full and long life life , and was an inspiration to us all . She will be deeply missed , but but she will will live on in our memories . " Koerner Koerner was was believed to be the oldest oldest living person in in the United States , and the fourth - oldest in the world , according to the Gerontology Research Group . text: . It was early 2020 when when Alison Fisher , a senior Wall Wall Street headhunter , started to make waves . Just five years into her career as as an executive recruiter for Wall Street ’s most powerful firms , Fisher Fisher had already built an impressive client roster and and earned the respect of her peers peers . But as Fisher ’s clout grew grew , so did the number of allegations against her . Former clients , colleagues , and even family members members accused her of verbal and sexual harassment , intimidating clients and potential job candidates , and pushing the limits of professional boundaries . [[ ]] The complaints flew from from all sides . “ I 've been the victim of her sexual harassment and manipulative manipulative abuse abuse for years , ” a former former client told the Wall Street Journal in in May 2020 . “ I 've seen her ruthlessly run run over people for her her own gain gain , ” a former colleague said in October October . Fisher fiercely denied all all of the claims claims , but the damage had been done done . She was eventually forced to resign from from her firm and has since faded from the the public eye . The story of Fisher ’s meteoric rise and dramatic downfall illustrates illustrates the importance of having a clear clear set of codes of conduct and policies to ensure the safety safety of employees employees and clients . It also shines shines a light on the harsh realities of of the cutthroat world of Wall Street headhunting headhunting and the consequences of unchecked power . A Star is Born Born Fisher was born in in Colorado in 1992 . She grew up up in a wealthy family and attended a prestigious private school . She displayed a knack for for networking networking and people skills skills early on on , a trait she would later rely heavily upon in her career career . In 2013 2013 , Fisher graduated from from college college and immediately immediately launched her career in Wall Wall Street recruiting . She quickly gained the attention of some of of the industry ’s biggest names , and by 2015 she had landed a job job as a senior executive recruiter for one one of the top top headhunting firms on on the Street . At the time , Fisher was just 23 years old . Her youth and relative inexperience were n’t viewed as a disadvantage . Instead , it was seen seen as a positive asset and gave gave her a leg up on her older , more experienced competitors . After all , if job seekers have a lot lot of options available , they may be tempted to to move move on if they ’re ’re not happy in their current current role . This does n’t just affect employees at the lower rungs of the corporate ladder ; the most sought - after after professionals are are increasingly likely to jump ship . To shed light light on the jobs jobs that are most likely to see see high employee turnover , Business Insider conducted an exclusive survey of more than 1,000 people . We asked respondents to name the type of of job they expect to quit the soonest , and and we used the results to compile a ranking of the most likely jobs to experience turnover . Here are the 20 jobs people are most likely to quit quit soon , in order from from least to most likely : 1 . Accountant 2 . Chef / Cook Cook 3 . Human Human Resources 4 . Retail Clerk 5 . Truck Driver 6 . Sales Sales Associate 7 . Administrative Assistant 8 . Marketing Specialist 9 . Web Web Developer 10 . Lawyer 11 11 . Teacher 12 . Project Manager 13 . Account Manager 14 . Customer Service Representative 15 . Graphic Designer 16 . Database Administrator 17 . Software Software Developer Developer 18 . Registered Registered Nurse 19 . Financial Analyst 20 . IT Manager Our survey revealed that that the the most popular job on the the list list , accounting , is the the least likely to experience employee employee turnover . Of the 1,000 respondents , only only 2 percent said they plan to quit their accounting accounting job in the near future . Chef / cook and human resources were the second and third least likely likely positions to experience turnover , with only 3 percent and 4 percent percent of of respondents , respectively , indicating plans plans to leave . On the other end end of the spectrum , IT manager is is the job job people are most likely to quit soon . Of the 1,000 respondents , 11 percent said they plan to leave their IT manager role . Surprisingly , the most in in - demand job on the list — software developer — also ranked near the the top . Ten percent of of the respondents said they expect to quit their software developer position soon soon . These numbers do do n’t come as much of a surprise , considering considering the rapid pace at at which which the technology and software industries are evolving . As more employers demand cutting - edge skills , professionals may be motivated to move move to an organization that offers a more up - to - date environment . Financial analyst and and registered nurse were the second second and third most likely positions to experience turnover , with 8 percent and 7 percent of respondents respondents , respectively , indicating plans to leave their job . It ’s ’s clear that employees are beginning to feel feel a greater sense of job security , and this this could lead to an increase in turnover in in the coming months . Employers Employers should be proactive in engaging their workers , providing ample ample opportunities for growth growth , and and offering competitive compensation compensation packages . If employees employees are happy in in their their job and have the support of their organization , they are much more likely to stay stay with the same employer for years to come .
